description: A large man sits comfortably, leaning back in a chair, while speaking intimately to a snail perched on his arm. The man addresses the snail as "Jimmy," imbuing the mollusk with a human identity and relationship. The surreal situation is heightened by the man recounting a classic human origin story, claiming the snail was found under a cabbage leaf. This absurd application of human narrative and familial roles to a garden creature creates a sense of irony and highlights the peculiar perspective presented.
caption: "That's right, Jimmy. ... One day your mother and I found you underneath a cabbage leaf."
